questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Between Cisco UCS Fls and Cisco ACI leaf switches, CDP is disabled, the LLDP is enabled, and LACP is in Active mode. Which two discovery protocols and load-balancing mechanism combinations can be implemented for the DVS? (Choose two.)

choices.E: CDP enabled, LLDP disabled, and LACP Passive
choices.B: CDP disabled, LLDP enabled, and MAC Pinning
choices.C: CDP enabled, LLDP disabled, and MAC Pinning
choices.A: CDP enabled, LLDP disabled, and LACP Active
choices.D: CDP enabled, LLDP enabled, and LACP Active
choices.F: CDP disabled, LLDP enabled, and LACP Passive

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B. CDP disabled, LLDP enabled, and MAC Pinning
C. CDP enabled, LLDP disabled, and MAC Pinning

B C seems to be correct, as per 
"NO LACP Support on
Host Facing Links.
MAC-Pinning!"

Slide 35 
https://www.ciscolive.com/c/dam/r/ciscolive/emea/docs/2020/pdf/BRKACI-2645.pdf

Selected Answer: AD
A. Disable unicast routing
D. Enable ARP flooding

disable unicast routing for gateway setup outside of ACI

A D seem to be correct options.
https://unofficialaciguide.com/2021/07/16/aci-best-practice-configurations/

Do not enable Unicast Routing if ACI is not the L3 Gateway for your Subnet. Why would you ever enable unicast routing if ACI is not the L3 Gateway? Without Unicast routing enabled, ACI will not learn the IP address for Endpoints. This leads some customers to enable Unicast routing, because (understandably) they want to learn the IP endpoint and not just the mac-address of connected devices. The problem with this, is it can lead to asymmetric routing, which can result in packets being dropped or mis-routed.

choices.B: Enable IP data plane learning for the VRF

discussion.content:
A is the correct answer 
Routing.https://unofficialaciguide.com/2019/11/08/understanding-scope-of-prefixes-in-l3-out-external-epg-in-aci/

Checking -Export Route Control Subnet enables a route map that allows external prefixes to get advertised out of your L3Out. Note the word “external prefixes”. This means that prefixes learnt from other L3Outs. In other words this is Transit

Selected Answer: D
D. Enable Export Route Control Subnet

for static

D is correct 
because Export route control subnet matches the exact prefix, which exist via static. This should not be confused with Export Aggregate, since the exact prefix exist as an static route, in other words it is external, therefore transient.

Selected Answer: B
B. Change one of the areas to area 0

for routing updates between backbone area 0 and other OSPF areas

From:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/solutions/collateral/data-center-virtualization/application-centric-infrastructure/guide-c07-743150.html#TransitRoutingtopology

"When Transit Routing is performed on the same border leaf across two OSPF L3Outs, one of them needs to be OSPF Area 0 because there will be a route exchange between the OSPF areas without going through infra MP-BGP." --> So indeed B.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which configuration must be implemented to allow intra-VRF transit routing between the two external routers?

choices.A: Deploy both areas under the same L3Out policy
choices.B: Change one of the areas to area 0
choices.D: Modify L3Out 1 to use the same OSPF area as L3Out 2
